Reviews.Title: Good phone to have
Reviews.Author: andrew ngo
Reviews.Content: 1. The real phone model is x10i (which I guess "i" stand for "international" version)2. After received, I install Sony Erricson PC Companion Software which will allow me to upgrade to Android 2.1 update 13. Phone look nice, compact (compare to other phone same class); however the back cover made of plastic, which makes it look cheap!!!.4. Screen protector also included (even x10i screen is anti-scratch)5. Phone works as I expected, pretty big screen, vivid color. 8.1M camera with smile detection, and other features seem nice to have.6. Take me a while to familiar with phone behavior, but once I get used to it, I like it.7. Virtual keyboard is nice in landscape mode, but difficult to use in portrait mode.8. If turn on WiFi, battery will be drained for a day, (but the same for Droid 2, Droid X). Turn off Wifi, it may last for 2 days. Set screen brightness to lowest level may extent more, and you can adjust its brightness by using widgets short cut.9. So far, I will happy with this phone!10. Without warranty, it might be potential problem!!!Update on 06/16/11:- Phone is still working :).- Another firmware update couple months ago which allow to do "multitouch" feature on X10i now. I think it is a big reason many guys don't want to buy X10 before.- Camera doesn't have flash (but a small LED), that will make you disappointed in dark place.

Reviews.Title: Execellent phone..
Reviews.Author: Hitman
Reviews.Content: I've heard about a lot of problem, but new firmware updated fixed them all.- Battery problem with OS 1.6 --> Please update to the latest firmware, everything will be fixed. Additional option: go to Ebay and buy couple more batteries for back-up which costs me $10 (which can't be done with Iphone)- My suggestion, go with OS 2.1, all inconveniences have been fixed, additional great features have been added, phone runs faster.Pros:- Large & beautiful big screen.- Fast processor, great speaker.- Very good camera & HD movie recorder.- Sensitive touch screen.- 3D games are awesomeCons:- In-call volume is a little bit low- I am having about 5% call dropped

Reviews.Title: Too many problems
Reviews.Author: J. Mcbee
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this phone. Initially I started out a bit happy, until I noticed the horrible battery life. I was averaging about 8 hours of low usage, which meant the phone would be dead before I got home at night. The 2.1 update (that took an extremely long time) made this somewhat better, but Sony has shown that they are terrible at rolling out updates at a reasonable pace.That actual deal breaker is a problem with the USB connection. Forums online have shown that it fails after 4-6 months, and I too have had this problem. While some people are successfully having it covered under the warranty, not all are. And the warranty is only a year long, so there is almost no chance this phone will survive the entire length of a 2 year contract. I'm hoping that SE comes up with a remedy for this fault, but I won't count on it. Until then, I would highly recommend that others avoid this phone.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Eduard
Reviews.Content: Excellent phone. Cover my expectative. Android is an excellent system. The only problem is the version of the system.Why Sony Ericcson launch this phone with 1.6 Android OS in instead of 2.2?

Reviews.Title: Disappointment.
Reviews.Author: V. Granados "rio4sure"
Reviews.Content: I was so happy to know that SE was coming out with a android phone, but I still wait a whole year to buy this model because I know by expirience sony ericsson always has software issues with their phones,Im starting to realize that sony is not as good as they claim to be, their phone software is still has the same problems from 5or more years back, for example wifi connectivity, with my nexus one, my phone stays connected all the time even if the phone goes to a sleep mode, and when I go out my 3g mode kicks in, when Im back home my phone switches automaticly to wifi mode, sony ericsson phone are difficult to get connected to a wifi network, and dont let me get started on the other issues concerning their old and outdated interfaces, going back to the X10 they claiming is a 8 mp camera (whata joke!) the pic quality is awful and they calling the little light they put on the phone a camera flash...and the so call timescape is the biggest joke, the facebook or tweeter accounts never updates, I could be writing all day about all the sony issues, but I have a life to live, so Sony get ur thing right or people will gonna get tire of all the disappointments, I have everthing sony in my home, but im starting to see my other options for my next TV, music system, camera, and phones, well actually I have a HTC phone now, and is wonderful..be careful sony ur going down!!!

Reviews.Title: Slick  phone more  compact than the  offereings from the American Providers..  perfect  size and fully  customizable without  hn
Reviews.Author: n rasavongseuk
Reviews.Content: After considering many smart phones in this class and all the carrier non-sense that goes along with these "data-locked' phone contracts from the US Carriers, ATT, T-Mobile, Verizon.  Why would you consider a Smartphone that you would like to have the ability to take abroad with you,  if you have to pay for a data service that would most likely triple your cellular package rates?  The  Xperia X10 is a great  Smartphone.  The  Timescape and Media Scape  interfaces  are  really sleek.  The 8.1  Mb  camera  resolution surpasses  many of the other  4" display phones in its nearest  Smartphone segment.  The Android Éclair 2.2  is not  as  painful or difficult  as  you would imagine, the  PC Companion installer app.  Its pre-installed Android 1.6 did have that slick thumb swipe launching mechanism which  made the phone more "slick" than the  original  I-phone  slide to open gesture.  All you need to do is plug in the USB cable that is supplied which the brand new  X1  remember to hold that back  key,  when connecting the USB to your  PC, as  with all other Sony-Ericsson's in the past,  Its their trade mark procedure.  The update is painless really.Purchasing  from Amazon you  have the reliability of a trusted  seller, middle man agent,  therefore  you  can rest assured that you will receive  the  product that you  worked so hard to be able to have, use.  Very  nice incorporation of Android Apps.; easy to find, download.

Reviews.Title: the phone arrived damaged
Reviews.Author: marco ruiz
Reviews.Content: the phone arrived damaged, does not work, will not start, it does nothing, lost money with this product, thank you very much

Reviews.Title: CRAP DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Nirmal
Reviews.Content: I brought this phone a year ago, after 9 months started randomly restarting. I never dropped the phone and took extremely good care of it (I had a case, cleaned it every week, never had too many applications running, etc...)well now it works for 20 minutes then turns off, doesn't even work as a phone anymore extremely unreliable.and apparently im not alone, if you go on sony ericssons website and click on the xperia x10 support forum you'll find hundreds if not thousands of complaints about random reboots and the phone stops working.and sony ericsson's support is terrible they dont care at all about their customers.never buy a sony ericsson product, they robbed me of 520 dollars for a piece of crap that barley worked a year (a Nokia without a color screen is a better phone than this)

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this phone without warranty!
Reviews.Author: Christopher
Reviews.Content: With a lot of excitement and expectation I bought this phone, but I was sadly disappointed when, all of a sudden, it stopped charging. On amazon, this phone has NO WARRANTY when unlocked, so I couldn't make a claim. After having this problem fixed (barely) the volume buttons (on the right side) stopped working as well! And there's no solution for it. With resignation, I finally found an app with which I could, at least, handle the volume on this piece of, ehm, "technology". But, to my surprise (not much of a surprise, really) now the phone won't establish a connection with ANY computer, so it's in the shop, yet again.Save yourself some trouble, Samsung Galaxy S, Nexus, HTC Desire, or any other brand would, definitively, make a better impression, with better costumer service (updates and stuff, cause still waiting for Android Froyo or Gingerbread).

Reviews.Title: It is not a good phone
Reviews.Author: Aha_Hi
Reviews.Content: I expected much from this phone but it turns out very bad!!!- Battery sucks! (i have no idea why Sony produces this, you just have to recharge more than 2 or 3 times a day)- Audio sound sucks! (it sounds just like a few dollars mp3 player)- Photo (hmmm... it don't think it is 8.1 Megapixel quality)Overall, find another phone...!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Austin
Reviews.Content: Pros:Screen has amazing quality, Sound is a bit weak in calls but 100x better than my last phone. Came pre-updated with Android 2.1Cons:Battery lifeOther Thoughts:With Android 2.1 the battery life has been enhanced, but I still have to charge it daily and not use all the apps as consistent as I would like to.

Reviews.Title: great product and just on time
Reviews.Author: Nabys
Reviews.Content: I will buy again from this merchant. Further, and very important. Think Green, Please protect animals and plants, recycle everything you can, no littering and use it enough to completely finish any product. Transmit this message to others.Comprare nuevamente en este negocio.  adicionalmente, Piensa Verde, por favor protege a los animales y las plantas, recicla todo lo que puedas, no echar basura, usa todo hasta el final, transmite este mensaje a otros.

Reviews.Title: simply a disaster
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Baile
Reviews.Content: got this phone as a gift and almost every phone related functional thing about it has a flaw, the baseband is not strong enough to hold on to GSM networks, when i travel to other countries the sim card freezes and i have to restart it. voice quality is not what expect of Sony Ericsson! I wish got a cheaper phone but it worked properly… :(

Reviews.Title: Phone says "unlocked" but keeps asking for PIN# when new sim card is inserted
Reviews.Author: Unice P. Benjamin "UPB"
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone to be used abroad in Jamaica and it keeps asking for PIN # when network sim card/s are inserted. WHY?

Reviews.Title: excellent phone
Reviews.Author: rodolfo
Reviews.Content: It is an excellent phone a resolution of acceptable image, takes very good pictures (for the price) and has everything a phone needs intelugente I'm really pleased with the purchase. also used to operating in Venezuela.

Reviews.Title: Dont buy them!
Reviews.Author: Laura Hernández
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these items and one doesn't even turn on! The other one does not work with the battery charger it came with, so I had to bought an extra charger (of course not through Amazon). These phones didn't came with any warranty, at the time I didn't care because  so far I had a good experience in buying electronic devices but from now on I'm buying nothing, This purchae was just a waste of money!

Reviews.Title: Difficulty in the usb port
Reviews.Author: Diego Sanchez
Reviews.Content: it presented a difficulty in the usb port, is very delicate, with 2 months of buying it I has to fix it

Reviews.Title: Not an international version!
Reviews.Author: Masoud
Reviews.Content: I bought the cellphone while I was taking a trip out of US, but unfortunately it didn't work out of US despite on its advertisement it said ,international version! Otherwise it is a good cell phone and I like it!

Reviews.Title: Problems upon problems!
Reviews.Author: Christal Davis
Reviews.Content: Google's new Play app store is not available to get on this phone which limits app selection. The phone runs slow and freezes a good bit. Not only that, but the touch gets off sometimes which results in sent messages before they're completed, typos, etc. I wouldn't recommend this phone to anyone. It's nothing but a major headache.

Reviews.Title: The worst
Reviews.Author: Asem M. Bala
Reviews.Content: Had it for 3 months and started malfunctioning like many other users. This phone suffers from different serious problems on both the hardware and software fronts. the software is outdated and won't be updated for months to come if ever. it's battery draining and useless. the hardware is supposedly great on a specification sheet, but in reality the phone suffers from a very low in-call volume, almost unusable outside or in bust streets, the battery lasts for a day max, the phone is also the source of many problems for it's users, and one look at the company's own support forum shows that several patches of the phone have defective mother boards that show as constant restarts and over heating.this is an expensive investment, so think it through before you go and buy this phone.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: A. Adrian "IT Guy"
Reviews.Content: This phone is great. I got it free from BB and it rocks. I have to say it's my first Android phone but I love it. Huge and sensitive screen at 4", great camera. I'm running A 1.6 but Sony has an upgrade to 2.1 that I'll install ASAP.Love this phone.

Reviews.Title: Sony Xperia half baked product
Reviews.Author: Klaus
Reviews.Content: From the time it was released in Mar 2010, it was near universally panned as a half-back piece of ... Nominally the specs were high end with a 4-inch 480 x 854 pixels display and 1Ghz processor. With initial retail (non-carrier "subsidized") of $600-$700, it was certainly priced as such. But in reality it only supports 65K colors (like computers from 15 years back) and performance was horrible with unacceptable user responsiveness. Incompetent designers and developers at Sony saddled what should have a marque product with buggy low performance. Hey ... let's put in Timescape so you when touch the screen it won't respond till 1/4 or half second later. Also smooth scrolling is so boring let's make the UI move in fits and starts with random stops in between.Prospective buyers can search for reviews on websites. I am not the only person unimpressed. I knew all this beforehand, but I bought it anyway. There were several reasons for this. Poor reception in the marketplace and introduction of new Xperia 2011 models means the X10 is now selling for a substantial discount to the introductory price. I also bought a Amazon-Warehouse highly discounted used, like new unit. Furthermore there seemed to be some improvement due to Android 2.1 update. By Q3-2010, there should be an Android 2.3 update, hopefully with more improvements.This particular model is sold as an unlocked international X10i (as opposed to American X10a). It has GSM 850/900/1800/1900 and UMTS/HSPA 900/1700/2100 frequencies. What this means is it will work fine for voice calls and 2G data just about anywhere in the world that has GSM carriers. It will work with 3G in most parts of the world outside the USA. In the USA, it will work with T-Mobile 3G, but will not work with AT&T; 3G (unless you get the X10a model). Unlocked means you can put in any SIM card you want without some evil carrier preventing you from using something you bought and paid for.The phone comes with a very large choice of UI menu languages including English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Portuguese, Russian, Greek, some Eastern Euro (Czech, Polish, ... etc.), Bahasa Indonesian, Malaysian, Chinese Traditional & Simplified, Japanese, Korean, Vietnamese, Thai, Tagalog, some Arabic languages, plus others I cannot recognize. THANK YOU, THANK YOU Sony for realizing there is a large world out there aside from English.So the GREAT language support, SIM unlocked, and 3G for international as well as USA T-mobile was the reason I bought the phone. There aren't that many models on the market that can meet these criteria. The Samsung Nexus S is one such.The model I received was actually a unit destined for Germany. But that doesn't matter as you can set the Language to be any of the large number of supported ones. Included in the box were phone, battery, 3.5mm jack/handsfree, Sony earphones, USB charging/data cable, USB charger with European prongs, European to US prong adapter, two plastic screen protectors, and a soft case.The USB wall charger is of course dual-voltage (100-240 VAC, 50-60Hz) and puts out 5 VDC 850 mA. This is more than a typical computer USB-2 port which puts out 500 mA. So charging with the USB cable plugged into the wall adapter is much faster than charging from a computer USB port.The boxy squarish design is quite unimaginative. More importantly the square corners with wedge shaped edges comes together as a sharp point with the fatal habit of painfully digging into the palm of the hand, especially when one reaches the thumb across the screen for UI touches. On my unit the flimsy plastic back cover does not snap on tightly to the chassis. It moves and creaks when handling the phone conveying a strong sense of cheap inept design. The top edge is a glossy piano black finish that reeks of tacky.________Update 2011-07-29:Sony has now released Android 2.3.2 for this phone. Be aware that if you have a carrier branded version, the update may not be available as you are at the mercy of your carrier. The UI does feel substantially faster and snappier. Practically speaking all the "slowness" problems have disappeared. Timescape no longer supports Email notifications. The dominant theme of the UI seems to be light gray on dim gray in order to diminish contrast so as to make sure the user has trouble seeing it, especially outdoors. If the phone is in flight mode and you ever try to access the "Contacts" (for off-line composing or just for info) the stupid thing will prompt you to import contacts, again, and again, and again, every time you access "Contacts". You still only get the crummy 65,000 colors that was standard for two decades ago.I tried playing some games that requires fast touch input and found that the touch screen response has a lag of one-several tenths of a second, which rendered fast pace games like Fruit Ninja unusable. This was verified with a handwriting recognition input keyboard that shows the strokes as you draw them. The lag is quite noticeable.For the good news, WiFi tethering now has built-in support due to Android 2.3. That's much easier than dealing with usb modems and drivers, but power drain will be high.I also have a Samsung GT-5830 (Galaxy Ace) which is considered a mid-range phone. In just about all design aspects, it just runs rings around this piece of crud. The Samsung display is far superior in terms of brightness, contrast, and power drain (although it is lower resolution). Icons are designed with good easily visible colors, and prominent appearance that give useful and tasteful info at a glance. Capacitive soft buttons for "menu" and "back" are much easier to use than the poorly placed hard buttons of the Xperia line. The Samsung Ace has a nice sliding door for the USB as opposed to a tacky rubber plug; microSD card is hot swappable without removing back cover, fit and finish is far superior.On the Samsung when the phone wake from power saver, it takes only a few seconds to reconnect to the WiFi. For the Sony X10i, it can take as long as 10-30 seconds, under the same circumstances and with the same WiFi access point. In fact often times the Sony will not reconnect at all even though it claims to have found all the access points in the scan. You have to turn off the WiFi and turn it on again, and wait wait wait.The X10i music player will burp whenever the screen rotates. One would think a 1Ghz processor could play music smoothly with competent engineering. In fact, it sometimes glitches for no apparent reason. I have all accounts and sync stuff turned off. This is really pathetic from the company that invented the Walkman and owns a music label.The X10i email client is broken with IMAP accounts. IMAP email does not allow access to all the folders available on the mail server. It does not properly cache downloaded emails. It will often lose sync with the IMAP server and previously downloaded headers disappear, requiring a time consuming and unreliable complete refresh of all messages. The client does not offer any option to move messages from one folder to another. In essence, it is nonfunctional.Using the same microSD card, the Samsung can write files transferred from a computer at over 10MB/sec whereas the Sony gets about 5-6 MB/sec. The touch screen on the Samsung responds much faster than the Sony.Other Samsung touches include things like putting a "recent" and "contacts" button next to the "To:" field when you compose emails lets you avoid typing in the email address manually - although the Sony will list matches once you do start typing. On the Samsung using the phone dialer will also do number or name matching. So you just begin typing the name or number on the numeric keypad, it will bring up all the matches and let you select. That's much easier than scrolling when you have more than a dozen or so contacts.IMO for anybody considering the Samsung Galaxy line vs this X10 or the newer Xperia models - no question, go for the Samsung Galaxy line. Samsung appears to have gone over their Galaxy designs with a fine tooth comb, trying to make every possible feature good for the user. Sony goes through their design and sees what they can fake for specification and marketing games, never mind the actual performance.I lowered my initial 2-star rating to 1-star. For this X10 phone, the more I use it, the less I like it.

Reviews.Title: Best Product for your money
Reviews.Author: Luis Torres
Reviews.Content: This smartphone with Android 2.1 is my phone every day. Looks great, is fast (1GHz), has a very good camera (8.1 Mpx) and a 4-inch touch screen. It comes equipped with a memory card and 8 GB of smartphones more hours per battery charge has given me. It's also lightweight for its size. Among the additions that Sony Ericsson put the Android is a feature I love, recognition of faces: when I take a picture of someone in my contacts, and have your picture on facebook or twitter, it automatically puts the name in picture just taken. This combined with the Timescape and "Infinity button, which displays everything in a contact (photos, twitter and facebook status, text messages and email, etc..) makes it very easy to find what I'm looking for a particular person. Of course, it has many applications available in the Android Market.This phone has accomplished what I went long, and strangers ask me "what phone is that" when they see me using it, and mention how attractive it looks. Comes in two colors, black and white, the one I use is black.Review by David Ochoa

Reviews.Title: Non-working, defective item
Reviews.Author: sinan
Reviews.Content: The phone I received is continuously closing when I opened it and also battery charge led has no response when I tried to charge the battery with charger came in box. I have unusable product in my hand!

Reviews.Title: The Rival to the iPhone
Reviews.Author: Rafik "RafikNY"

} } } Length:: 1:11 MinsSearching for a smartphone but you don't want an Iphone or Blackberry? Look no more. Here is a great product! After my nightmare with a defective MOTO Backflip, The Sony Experia X10 is truly an amazing device and is the rival to the iPhone/blackberry. For my needs it's perfect. Great sound and video. Pictures are amazing at 8mp. Sure the battery life can be better but most devices are this way especially if you are a heavy user. Note: AT&T; has a great deal on these phones. Droid phones R HOT! Checkout amazing wireless deals and more at Amazon. **UPDATE: X10 will be upgrading up to Droid 2.1 in October/November**Here is a video showing you some features of X10. Enjoy~!

Reviews.Title: Worst phone I've ever owned.
Reviews.Author: John Casey "zzjeep"
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on Wirefly on the Sony Xperia with a 2-year contract with AT&T.;  Problem is, the phone is the absolute worst functioning, worthless device I've ever had the misfortune of owning.  Nothing, I repeat, NOTHING works on it the way it should.  Even the camera.  You turn it off, turn it back on, and you have to reset all your settings, such as volume, ringtone, contact lists, etc.  Not worth bothering with.  Battery doesn't hold a charge for a full day without warning you the battery is getting low.  It goes in the garbage, I'm getting a new phone.  Never, ever again will I buy Sony for cellphone use.

Reviews.Title: Thank-you!!!
Reviews.Author: Godwin Mindra
Reviews.Content: As expected and thank-you! will come to buy again. It is a very good phone and easy to use. Cheers

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: SultanBadza
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone for myself and really loved it. As I had to go from home for work left it for my sister, and she's still using it as loves it. She bought some frames for it and cannot leave it anymore.

Reviews.Title: Case with no phone
Reviews.Author: Celso
Reviews.Content: I just got the package and when i opened the cellphone box the cellphone itself was NOT there!!!!! what's that about? I'm really dissapointed. i've been buying from amazon for a long time now and i never had a problem until now. i asked for a replacement so hopefully everything will be ok now

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Nure Alam S. Kabir "Kabir"
Reviews.Content: This is good product as Android os. i like this but it's working some kind of slow for me. but it's ok.

Reviews.Title: good phone for non travelling professionals
Reviews.Author: vbalasanov
Reviews.Content: this phone has a lot of amazing features, such as timescape, mediascape and few other apps that SE has designed for ANDROID.My biggest problem is battery life. I spend a lot of time on the streets between appointments, and i find myself trying to recharge the phone by 2-3pm same day, and in car charger is horrible, charges very slow.video and pic quality is great, however no flash makes it somewhat tricky...

Reviews.Title: Xperia X10 is fine
Reviews.Author: Evidence
Reviews.Content: Sony Ericsson Xperia X10 is a excellent phone.I like it. I live in Ecuador and works well.It would be good for a future version to include a larger internal memory.Consider improving battery performance.The next version, the Xperia Arc looks like a great development

Reviews.Title: Terrible Phone, lots of problems from factory
Reviews.Author: Gabriel Perez
Reviews.Content: to be short on my review:The bad:Comes with an old version of Android (1.6) does not exploit all the hardwareNo multitouch (I cannot forgive this on a 2011 phone)In call volume VERY LOW , cannot hear the other person in the streets of my noisy cityNo quick response from sony on software upgradesThe good:all of the above might be fixed with a software upgrade , but only heavens know when it's gonna be

Reviews.Title: do NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: H. Hristov
Reviews.Content: In November 2010 I bought the Sony Ericsson XPERIA X10 black model from AT&T.; I don't have anything positive to say about this phone, only negative things. The camera takes very bad photos the quality is disgusting, the video is not good either, the phone is not as fast as advertised at all, powers up slow, and works sluggishly. The phone doesn't have a good antenna either, when I go inside a store, the signal is gone. Two weeks after I bought this dinosaur, it started to give me serous problems, when I am in a call I CAN'T END CALL, I have to wait for the person I am talking with to hang up on me, also during a call the touch screen dialpad will lock up, and I CAN'T use the dialpad. Also I can't connect to some bluetooth devices such as my laptop, printers, and my Motorola ear piece using the phone's bluethoot. I have called AT&T; and reported all those problems, it is now almost the end of January 2011, and I am waiting my 3 replacement handset from AT&T;, hopefully the 4th handset will work and I will finally have a phone, if it doesn't I will buy another phone, since the X10 is garbage.

Reviews.Title: VERY GOOD PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: VERY GOOD ANDROID PHONE - THE PROBLEM IS THAT I WAS ROBBED BECAUSE OF IT' S QUALITY - IF YOU BUY BEWARE THE THIETS

Reviews.Title: Excellent phone and delivery
Reviews.Author: Otavio
Reviews.Content: Both phone and delivery were amazing!Only problem I had was with UPS phone support, that was lame. However, Amazon online support was amazing and they arrange my delivery to work on time.Phone works greatly: nice screen resolution and CPU speed, and camera is very good also.Phone work with any carrier, so I definetly recommend it for anyone looking for an upper-mid range Android phone!

Reviews.Title: Xperiencing new with Xperia X10
Reviews.Author: Surendar
Reviews.Content: Hi pals,Great to meet you all with an excellent product. I have bought this  a month ago and totally convinced with the features and abilities it can provide the user. It TOP's the list for Smartphone in features compared to iPhone and Blackberry classes. The video playback and quality of sound it produces is awesome. Last but not the least I would personally suggest people to go for this Smartphone if you wish to go for one and its cost is comparatively less with its class phones.

Reviews.Title: superb!!!
Reviews.Author: CADEN
Reviews.Content: sony Ericsson xperia x10 is the bomb!!though they should improve the in-call volume. Buy this from Amazon they the Best

Reviews.Title: The x10 that can't....or could?
Reviews.Author: R. Jackson
Reviews.Content: The X10 is a good 'wanna be' product thats typical of Sony; could be a whole lot better - but lacks the overall punch here. The facts: It'll drain your battery like Obama did to our economy. 2)The Android OS that ships on it is pathetically outdated and is marred by imperfections and stagnation that trips up at odd times. 3)Has no 'real' way to kill an app easily like (as I hate to make a reference here...) the iPhone does. 4) And probably the most important thing here presenting it in a full unbiased tone - simply lacks functionality refinement compared to the iPhone's interface and touch sensitivity for correctness on exact touch location recognition.The phone itself -- IS ROCK SOLID! This is a huge plus and the music earbuds that come with this are impressively impeccable! Sound is truly ONE of the strong points on this phone. Sony by no way impresses me after the 90s and this product is no exception. It lacks just the right amount of overall polishing that the iPhone delivers amazingly well and rightfully puts the Android OS at a clear sub-standard venue. Don't get me wrong; I'm NOT an APPLE fan by no means, but product vs product, the Sony Xperia simply is not polished as people make it out to be.I think a better marriage would be for Sony to substantially push the LATEST Android OS out as being mandatory. Not sure if they could do this, but clearly other phones with the latest OS are amazingly better in touch interface capability - which is ONE of the main reasons we 'like' smart phones - right?

ProductInfo.Features:
Display: 4.0 inches 854 x 480 pixels, TFT LCD capacitive touchscreen display, 262K colors, Scratch-resistant surface, Accelerometer sensor for auto-rotate, Timescape/Mediascape UI
Quad-band GSM/GPRS/EDGE: 850/900/1800/1900 MHz. HSDPA 900/1700/2100
Operating System: Android OS 1.6. Processor: Qualcomm QSD8250 Snapdragon 1 GHz processor
Camera: 8 MP, 3264x2448 pixels, autofocus, LED flash. Touch focus, image stabilization, geo-tagging, face and smile detection. Video: WVGA@30fps
Talk time: Up to 415 h (2G)/Up to 425 h (3G). Standby time: Up to 10 h (2G)/Up to 8 h (3G)
Display: 4.0 inches 854 x 480 pixels, TFT capacitive touchscreen, 262K colors, Scratch-resistant surface, Accelerometer sensor for auto-rotate, Timescape/Mediascape UI
